admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall project outcome was deemed
            satisfactory, with project sustainability likely. One
            hundred percent of project objectives was achieved But for
            delay in completing the project by 18 months, the project
            might have merited a "highly satisfactory" rating.
            Both World Bank and Borrower performances were satisfactory.
            Key lessons learned include the following: For procurement
            of specialized contracts, e.g., gas meters, supervisory
            control and data acquisition and monitoring system (SCADA),
            etc., greater review should be made on the specifications
            prepared by the consultants. Second, the consultants staff
            should work closely with PETROGAS, the petroleum gas company
            in Cairo, and not entirely in their head office. Third, the
            World Bank's close supervision and close continuous
            communication in resolving outstanding issues greatly
            contributed to achieving success.
